title: Fixing minor nits: conversion to u16 and removing keypair constructor
One-liner fix for deserialization test for CredentialResponse
Add copyright header and update server consistency documentation
Expose public key in ClientRegistrationFinishResult
body:
I realized this is more in line with the style then #192.

This enables to obtain the servers public key during registration.

title: Update dependencies
body:
This updates the following dependencies:
- curve25519-dalek: 3.0.0 -> 3.1.0
- hkdf: 0.10.0 -> 0.11.0
- hmac: 0.10.1 -> 0.11.0
- crypto-mac (sub-dependency): 0.10.0 -> 0.11.0

I skipped updating `displaydoc` because the [multi-line change](https://github.com/yaahc/displaydoc/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#changed) they did is annoying.

It is [usually recommended](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/guide/cargo-toml-vs-cargo-lock.html#cargotoml-vs-cargolock) that libraries don't include `Cargo.lock`, what is opaque-ke's take on this?

title: Implement common traits
body:
This is an attempt to make sure that all exposed types implement `Clone`, `Debug`, `Deserialize` and `Serialize`. As a bonus I threw in `Eq`, `Hash` and `PartialEq` because it was no extra effort.

I skipped on implementing it on the `XxxResult` types because their public members are covered, which works great for our use-case, but adding them would be simple.

`Hash` might not be appropriate in a couple of places, I wouldn't know.

title: Argon2 implementation
body:
I removed the `slow-hash` feature and replaced it with `scrypt` and `argon`. As per spec recommendation, I chose Argon2id, but I am no cryptographer and a different variant might be desirable when used in OPAQUE.

Fixes #179.

title: Rebasing v0.6 changes onto master
body: Includes support for client enumeration mitigations (introducing credential_identifier, server_setup), as well as support for fake credential response and the new "internal" mode for the envelope.

title: Adding identity element checks and ensuring non-zero scalar selection
Enforce public vs private keys via types
body:
With this change, it's no longer possible to pass a public key where a private one is expected, and vice-versa.

I *might* have made the mistake when using this library :)

title: Implement Clone for every message type
body:
This makes it much easier to handle the messages as part of a framework (e.g. actix where in some cases move-only is not possible). Note that it was _technically_ possible so far using `serialize` and `deserialize`, but that's inefficient and ugly.

Note that just using `#[derive(Clone)]` is not possible for many of the types, since they are generic over `CS`, and deriving `Clone` would add the requirement that `CS` is `Clone`, which in turns would require `KeyExchange` to be `Clone`, which doesn't make sense (we never own an instance of it).

title: Ensure that all public keys are being checked when deserialized
Adding documentation of slow-hash + other features
Adding support for "internal mode" and fake credential response + test vectors
Implement serde serialization and deserialization
body:
Provide a standard interface for serialization and deserialization using serde.

This makes it much easier to pass messages as part of protocols.

Fixes #166

title: Add zeroize on drop for keys, keypairs, and Client/Server Registration/Login
body:
Ensures that zeroize on drop occurs for:
- KeyPair
- Key
- ClientRegistration
- ClientLogin
- ServerRegistration
- ServerLogin

In order to test this behavior, we also add an as_byte_ptrs() function to expose raw pointers for each of these objects (only when test mode is enabled). Then we call zeroize directly on these objects and check that the pointers point to zero'd out memory.

Note that other methods that involve actually "dropping" the memory are flaky and inconsistent.

Closes #158

title: Adding reference to wasm package and link to examples in README
Zeroize keys on drop
body: Currently the main key structure is not zeroized on drop. This diff adds this best practice functionality.
